channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report E-2025030174
item.description:
Report E-2025030174

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-23T01:09:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: STEWARTVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed the top of one (1) 330-gallon IBC plastic tote was damaged and approximately twenty (20) ounces of material released impacting the trailer floor. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and placed the spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining product was transferred into a new 330-gallon poly tote and shipped onto the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025030923
item.description:
Report X-2025030923

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2025030923 -HAZMAT CLERK NOTICED AN ODOR COMING FROM THIS PACKAGE WHILE IT SAT ON THE 8 WAY IRREG UNLOAD. IT HAD MINOR LIQUID LEAKS INTERNALLY, NO LIQUID LEAKED BEYOND THE EXTERNAL PACKAGING. X-2025030924-HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUTH THEIR TAM OVER AND SAID ONE OF THE HAZMATS ON THEIR TRAM HAD A STRONG ODOR COMMING FROM IT. INSPECTING THE HAZMAT IT HAD BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS AND INSIDE WERE 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS. ONE OF THE CAPS HAD BEN SCREWED ON CROOKED WHICH ALLOWED THE INNER CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT.

item.title: Report X-2025030433
item.description:
Report X-2025030433

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CAME TO OUR WORKSTATION AND SAID THERE WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT AT THE IRREG/HAZMAT SORT ROLLER. AT THE SORT ROLLER RESPONDER FOUND A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH BOTH 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS ON THE FLOOR WITH SOME LIQUID. THE PACKAGE AND THE LEAKED CONTENTS WERE CLEANED UP AND TAKEN BACK TO THE DMP FOR INSPECTION AND PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025030097
item.description:
Report E-2025030097

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: SHAKOPEE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5515
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer prior to having the delivery hose connected to the storage tank. This allowed approximately 5 gallons of gasoline to be released. EX Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2025030184
item.description:
Report X-2025030184

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS TRIBUNE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UTLX 952548 was found leaking in the Northtown, MN Railyard Yard on 02/07/25. After inspection it was determined UTLX 952548 was leaking from the Liquid valve due to the valve being open and the plug loose. The BNSF Responder closed the valve, tighten the plug and released it to final destination.
